decks.notes: This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down while also disrupting the opponent's hand with Duress. The deck also includes evasive threats like Spyglass Siren and Deep-Cavern Bat to apply pressure on the opponent. Enduring Curiosity and Tishana's Tidebinder provide card advantage and tempo, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive strategy. The inclusion of Sheoldred, the Apocalypse as a finisher adds a powerful threat that can quickly close out games. The deck aims to outpace the opponent with its aggressive creatures and disruption spells.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Tinybones, the Pickpocket and Alesha, Who Laughs at Fate, along with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Torch the Tower to control the board. The key strategy is to apply pressure early with efficient creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Duress. With a mix of powerful creatures and removal spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and finish the game quickly before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and combat tricks. The key strategy is to play efficient threats like Patchwork Beastie and Wildfire Wickerfolk, while using cards like Violent Urge and Bushwhack to push through damage. The deck also includes removal spells like Break Out and Convenient Target to maintain board control. By utilizing a combination of creatures with powerful abilities and combat tricks, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a combination of evasive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing creatures like Nurturing Pixie and Sunpearl Kirin to apply pressure early on, followed by cards like Hopeless Nightmare and Momentum Breaker to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Preacher of the Schism and Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber provides flexibility in dealing with different threats while maintaining a proactive game plan. The mana base is built to support a consistent curve of plays while providing access to both white and black spells.

The key concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By using a combination of low-cost creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Marauding Mako, along with spells like Torch the Tower and Abrade, the deck aims to establish early board presence and pressure the opponent while maintaining control of the game. The inclusion of cards like Guardian of New Benalia and Profit's Eidetic Memory provides additional support and card advantage to keep up the pressure and close out the game swiftly.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Marauding Mako, and spells like Fear of Missing Out and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes some control elements with cards like Spyglass Siren and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the goal is to maintain a fast pace and finish off the opponent before they can establish a strong defense.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Drake Hatcher, while also using spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Stormchaser's Talent to further enhance the aggro strategy. With a mix of cheap creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures and spells. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, as well as burn spells such as Burst Lightning, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly. The inclusion of card draw and filtering spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand helps maintain momentum and find key cards. With a balanced mix of creatures and spells, the deck seeks to maintain a steady offensive strategy while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. By managing the opponent's threats and resources, you can maintain the upper hand and dictate the pace of the game. With access to a variety of powerful spells and versatile creatures, you can effectively disrupt your opponent's plans while building up your own board presence. By carefully utilizing your resources and strategic planning, you can outmaneuver your opponent and emerge victorious in the end.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to effectively control the board and outlast opponents by using a combination of removal spells, card draw, and life gain. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans with counterspells like Dispelling Exhale and removal spells like Lightning Helix, while also generating card advantage through cards like Stock Up and Split Up. By utilizing Marang River Regent and other finishers, the deck can eventually win the game through incremental advantage and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays using a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It incorporates a high number of low-cost creatures to establish an early board presence and pressure the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes a selection of counter spells and removal to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is constructed to ensure consistent access to all three colors of mana required for the deck's powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana to play Omniscience, which allows you to cast spells for free. Then, you can use cards like Roiling Dragonstorm and Moment of Truth to deal massive damage to your opponent. Marang River Regent and Fallaji Archaeologist are essential combo pieces that can help you control the board and protect your combo. With this deck, you aim to overwhelm your opponent with powerful spells while also maintaining control and advantage through various means such as counterspells and removal.

The main concept of this Orzhov Control deck is to establish early board control through cards like Corroding Dragonstorm and Momentum Breaker. It aims to disrupt opponent's strategies with cards like Temporary Lockdown and Hopeless Nightmare, while also generating card advantage through Wishclaw Talisman and Scrollshift. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse acts as a powerful finisher, while Sunpearl Kirin and Nurturing Pixie provide support. The deck also includes mana fixing lands like Concealed Courtyard and Caves of Koilos to ensure consistent casting of spells. Additionally, Restless Fortress and Preacher of the Schism offer additional defensive options.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells in order to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter along with powerful instant spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of card draw spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand helps to maintain card advantage and ensure a steady stream of threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, high-impact creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. By combining creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter with spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of aggression while controlling the board with counterspells like Spell Pierce. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and speed, allowing for quick deployment of threats and maximizing the deck's overall efficiency in dealing damage.

The deck focuses on quickly playing small creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. It uses low-cost spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to control the board and boost the power of creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter. The inclusion of cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand helps dig for key pieces of the deck while cards like Stock Up provide card advantage. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a variety of spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to maintain board presence and limit the opponent's options through removal and counter spells. The creatures in the deck have strong abilities that complement the control aspect of the deck, allowing for strategic plays and long-term advantage. The mana base is built to support the control elements of the deck, with a mix of different lands to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this Control deck is to utilize a variety of spells and creatures to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Cards like Day of Judgment and Authority of the Consuls help control the board, while Heritage Reclamation and Leyline Binding provide additional utility. The deck also focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Up the Beanstalk and utilizing powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Zur, Eternal Schemer to dominate the battlefield. The deck is designed to outlast opponents and establish dominance through strategic plays.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm and disrupt opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By using efficient creatures like Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner, alongside control spells like Duress and Go for the Throat, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while dealing constant damage. Cards like Phantom Interference and Deep-Cavern Bat provide further disruption and tempo advantage, making it hard for the opponent to stabilize. The deck also includes a mix of graveyard recursion and card draw to maintain resources and pressure.

The main objective of this Esper Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining board control through counterspells, removal spells, and creature lockdown effects. By utilizing a combination of hand disruption, creature removal, and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually win through card advantage and powerful finishers like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Sunpearl Kirin. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all three colors and ensure smooth gameplay throughout the match.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal, and board wipes. The deck also utilizes card draw and resource generation to maintain card advantage and outvalue the opponent. By controlling the pace of the game and gradually gaining incremental advantage, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through superior card quality and strategic decision-making. The deck's win conditions include powerful finishers like Marang River Regent and Beza, the Bounding Spring.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to heavily disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's board development using cards like Temporary Lockdown and Day of Judgment, while also efficiently removing threats with cards like Lightning Helix and Abrade. The deck also includes card draw and filtering options to ensure consistent access to key cards. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent through a combination of control and resource management.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Omniscience Combo, which allows players to cast spells from their hand without paying their mana cost. This combo is supported by cards like Marang River Regent, Moment of Truth, and Roiling Dragonstorm. There are also control elements like Spell Pierce and Temporary Lockdown to disrupt opponents and protect the combo. The deck aims to generate card advantage with Meticulous Archive and Stock Up, while using Floodfarm Verge and various lands for mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to combo off and overwhelm opponents with powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with a mix of low-cost creatures and powerful threats such as Sunpearl Kirin and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Get Lost and Temporary Lockdown to control the board and prevent the opponent from mounting a defense. The mana base is designed to support both white and black cards, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the Orzhov Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming your opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells, aiming to finish the game as fast as possible. By constantly applying pressure and dealing damage to the opponent's life total, the deck aims to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize or mount a strong defense. The creatures in the deck have low mana costs and high attack power, allowing for fast and efficient damage output. Direct damage spells provide additional reach and removal options, ensuring that the opponent's defenses can be easily broken through.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm and aggressively attack the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells. By using efficient creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Hired Claw along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike, the goal is to quickly deplete the opponent's life total before they can establish their own game plan. The inclusion of cards like Manifold Mouse and Tersa Lightshatter and the land base of mostly Mountains allow for consistent and fast starts to put pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Slickshot Show-Off, and Cori-Steel Cutter to deal damage swiftly to the opponent. Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage provide additional damage spells, while Opt and Sleight of Hand help with card advantage. Stormchaser's Talent enhances the creatures' abilities, and Into the Flood Maw can provide a tempo advantage. Stock Up helps to refill the hand while Spell Pierce offers some protection. The mana base consists of Islands, Mountains, Riverpyre Verge, Shivan Reef, and Spirebluff Canal to ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. By utilizing low-cost spells and creatures with abilities like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own board presence. Cards like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage provide additional damage and removal options, while Opt and Sleight of Hand help with card selection and increasing card advantage. Overall, the goal is to outpace the opponent and win the game through aggression and quick plays.

The deck focuses on quickly casting low-cost creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent as efficiently as possible, while also utilizing card draw and burn spells to maintain pressure and control the board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick and aggressive plays, while also having versatile answers to opponent's threats. The mana base is optimized for casting spells on curve and ensuring a consistent flow of resources.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy low-cost creatures and spells to apply pressure on the opponent and deal damage efficiently. Utilizing creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and filtering effects like Opt and Sleight of Hand to maintain card advantage and consistency. The mana base is built to support the aggressive gameplay with a mix of lands that provide both blue and red mana sources.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast-paced aggressive strategy using creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, supported by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand to ensure consistency and maintain momentum. The goal is to quickly build a board presence and deal damage efficiently, utilizing the UR color combination to maximize versatility and threat potential.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy and controlling the game through a combination of lockdown effects, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing a mix of defensive tools and mana manipulation, it aims to outlast the opponent and eventually overwhelm them with a combination of threats and resource denial. The deck's strength lies in its ability to adapt to various situations while maintaining a strong defensive posture, ultimately grinding down the opponent's resources until victory is assured.
